member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.App
member.summary: Provides application-specific behavior to supplement the default Application class.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.App.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes the singleton application object. This is the first line of authored code executed, and as such is the logical equivalent of main() or WinMain().

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.App.OnLaunched(Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.LaunchActivatedEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when the application is launched normally by the end user. Other entry points will be used when the application is launched to open a specific file, to display search results, and so forth.
member.param: Details about the launch request and process.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.App.RootFrame_FirstNavigated(System.Object,Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Restores the content transitions after the app has launched.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.App.OnSuspending(System.Object,Windows.ApplicationModel.SuspendingEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when application execution is being suspended. Application state is saved without knowing whether the application will be terminated or resumed with the contents of memory still intact.
member.param: The source of the suspend request.
Details about the suspend request.

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper
member.summary: NavigationHelper aids in navigation between pages. It provides commands used to navigate back and forward as well as registers for standard mouse and keyboard shortcuts used to go back and forward in Windows and the hardware back button in Windows Phone. In addition it integrates SuspensionManger to handle process lifetime management and state management when navigating between pages.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.#ctor(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A reference to the current page used for navigation. This reference allows for frame manipulation and to ensure that keyboard navigation requests only occur when the page is occupying the entire window.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.GoBackCommand
member.summary:
used to bind to the back Button's Command property for navigating to the most recent item in back navigation history, if a Frame manages its own navigation history.
The is set up to use the virtual method as the Execute Action and for CanExecute.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.GoForwardCommand
member.summary:
used for navigating to the most recent item in the forward navigation history, if a Frame manages its own navigation history.
The is set up to use the virtual method as the Execute Action and for CanExecute.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.CanGoBack
member.summary: Virtual method used by the property to determine if the can go back.
member.returns: true if the has at least one entry in the back navigation history.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.CanGoForward
member.summary: Virtual method used by the property to determine if the can go forward.
member.returns: true if the has at least one entry in the forward navigation history.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.GoBack
member.summary: Virtual method used by the property to invoke the method.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.GoForward
member.summary: Virtual method used by the property to invoke the method.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.HardwareButtons_BackPressed(System.Object,Windows.Phone.UI.Input.BackPressedEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when the hardware back button is pressed. For Windows Phone only.
member.param: Instance that triggered the event.
Event data describing the conditions that led to the event.

member.name: E:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.LoadState
member.summary: Register this event on the current page to populate the page with content passed during navigation as well as any saved state provided when recreating a page from a prior session.

member.name: E:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.SaveState
member.summary: Register this event on the current page to preserve state associated with the current page in case the application is suspended or the page is discarded from the navigaqtion cache.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.OnNavigatedTo(Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when this page is about to be displayed in a Frame. This method calls , where all page specific navigation and process lifetime management logic should be placed.
member.param: Event data that describes how this page was reached. The Parameter property provides the group to be displayed.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.NavigationHelper.OnNavigatedFrom(Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when this page will no longer be displayed in a Frame. This method calls , where all page specific navigation and process lifetime management logic should be placed.
member.param: Event data that describes how this page was reached. The Parameter property provides the group to be displayed.

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.SaveStateEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventArgs
member.summary: Class used to hold the event data required when a page attempts to load state.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventArgs.NavigationParameter
member.summary: The parameter value passed to when this page was initially requested.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventArgs.PageState
member.summary: A dictionary of state preserved by this page during an earlier session. This will be null the first time a page is visited.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventArgs.#ctor(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The parameter value passed to when this page was initially requested.
A dictionary of state preserved by this page during an earlier session. This will be null the first time a page is visited.

member.summary: Class used to hold the event data required when a page attempts to save state.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.SaveStateEventArgs.PageState
member.summary: An empty dictionary to be populated with serializable state.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SaveStateEventArgs.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An empty dictionary to be populated with serializable state.

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.ObservableDictionary
member.summary: Implementation of IObservableMap that supports reentrancy for use as a default view model.

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand
member.summary: A command whose sole purpose is to relay its functionality to other objects by invoking delegates. The default return value for the CanExecute method is 'true'. needs to be called whenever is expected to return a different value.

member.name: E:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.CanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Raised when RaiseCanExecuteChanged is called.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.#ctor(System.Action)
member.summary: Creates a new command that can always execute.
member.param: The execution logic.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.#ctor(System.Action,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a new command.
member.param: The execution logic.
The execution status logic.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.CanExecute(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this can execute in its current state.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.
member.returns: true if this command can be executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the on the current command target.
member.param: Data used by the command. If the command does not require data to be passed, this object can be set to null.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.RelayCommand.RaiseCanExecuteChanged
member.summary: Method used to raise the event to indicate that the return value of the method has changed.

member.name: T:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager
member.summary: SuspensionManager captures global session state to simplify process lifetime management for an application. Note that session state will be automatically cleared under a variety of conditions and should only be used to store information that would be convenient to carry across sessions, but that should be discarded when an application crashes or is upgraded.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.SessionState
member.summary: Provides access to global session state for the current session. This state is serialized by and restored by , so values must be serializable by and should be as compact as possible. Strings and other self-contained data types are strongly recommended.

member.name: P:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.KnownTypes
member.summary: List of custom types provided to the when reading and writing session state. Initially empty, additional types may be added to customize the serialization process.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.SaveAsync
member.summary: Save the current . Any instances registered with will also preserve their current navigation stack, which in turn gives their active an opportunity to save its state.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that reflects when session state has been saved.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.RestoreAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Restores previously saved . Any instances registered with will also restore their prior navigation state, which in turn gives their active an opportunity restore its state.
member.param: An optional key that identifies the type of session. This can be used to distinguish between multiple application launch scenarios.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that reflects when session state has been read. The content of should not be relied upon until this task completes.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.RegisterFrame(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a instance to allow its navigation history to be saved to and restored from . Frames should be registered once immediately after creation if they will participate in session state management. Upon registration if state has already been restored for the specified key the navigation history will immediately be restored. Subsequent invocations of will also restore navigation history.
member.param: An instance whose navigation history should be managed by
A unique key into used to store navigation-related information.
An optional key that identifies the type of session. This can be used to distinguish between multiple application launch scenarios.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.UnregisterFrame(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame)
member.summary: Disassociates a previously registered by from . Any navigation state previously captured will be removed.
member.param: An instance whose navigation history should no longer be managed.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.Common.SuspensionManager.SessionStateForFrame(Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame)
member.summary: Provides storage for session state associated with the specified . Frames that have been previously registered with have their session state saved and restored automatically as a part of the global . Frames that are not registered have transient state that can still be useful when restoring pages that have been discarded from the navigation cache.
member.remarks: Apps may choose to rely on to manage page-specific state instead of working with frame session state directly.
member.param: The instance for which session state is desired.
member.returns: A collection of state subject to the same serialization mechanism as .

member.summary: Hadles perform click. Sends form to server.

member.summary: Gets the associated with this .

member.summary: Gets the view model for this . This can be changed to a strongly typed view model.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.pages.AbsenceManagementPage.NavigationHelper_LoadState(System.Object,ShowcaseWP.Common.LoadStateEventArgs)
member.summary: Populates the page with content passed during navigation. Any saved state is also provided when recreating a page from a prior session.
member.param: The source of the event; typically

Event data that provides both the navigation parameter passed to when this page was initially requested and a dictionary of state preserved by this page during an earlier session. The state will be null the first time a page is visited.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.pages.AbsenceManagementPage.NavigationHelper_SaveState(System.Object,ShowcaseWP.Common.SaveStateEventArgs)
member.summary: Preserves state associated with this page in case the application is suspended or the page is discarded from the navigation cache. Values must conform to the serialization requirements of .
member.param: The source of the event; typically
Event data that provides an empty dictionary to be populated with serializable state.

member.name: M:ShowcaseWP.pages.AbsenceManagementPage.OnNavigatedTo(Windows.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary:
The methods provided in this section are simply used to allow NavigationHelper to respond to the page's navigation methods.
Page specific logic should be placed in event handlers for the
and . The navigation parameter is available in the LoadState method in addition to page state preserved during an earlier session.
member.param: Provides data for navigation methods and event handlers that cannot cancel the navigation request.
